questions.text:
Identify the correct pair with the type of prevention:

 

  1. Prescriptive screening-Secondary
  2. HPV Vaccination against ca cervix-Primary
  3. Iodine supplementation in salt-Primordial
  4. Pap smear in health camp-Primary
  5. Spectacles-tertiary
Identify the correct ASA-PS grade:

choices.text: Reassure as he is vaccinated

questions.text: A 10 year old child has been diagnosed with diphtheria and is being treated in the ward. His 2.5-year-old brother, who lives in the same house has received all due vaccinations according to NIS. What is the next best step for the management of the younger sibling?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Erythromycin only

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements about vaccines

 

  1. Influenza and yellow fever vaccines are CI in egg allergy
  2. Abscess formation post-BCG is treated conservatively
  3. Live vaccines should not be given with Human immunoglobulin except measles
  4. All of the following are killed vaccines: Pertussis, Salk, SA14-14-2, 17D
  5. NS is used as diluent for Danish 1331
questions.solution: Ans. D) 1,5

questions.text: You are preparing to intubate a patient in the operating room. As part of your preoperative assessment, you perform a Mallampati examination to assess the patient's airway. Identify the class from the image shown below?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Mallampati Class III

choices.text: Higher number of false negatives
Higher positive predictive value
Lower number of false positives

questions.text: A novel serum biomarker is being evaluated for early detection of pancreatic cancer. The concentration of this substance has been found to be elevated in patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma. Test results in 200 volunteers ("healthy") and 190 patients with biopsy-proven pancreatic cancer ("diseased") are given in the figure below. The investigators determined the sensitivity and specificity of this indicator for pancreatic cancer using a cutoff of 200 IU/dL (indicated by the solid vertical. If they had instead used a lower cutoff as indicated by the dashed vertical line, which of the following would most likely be seen?
questions.solution: Ans. C) ﻿﻿﻿Higher sensitivity

questions.text:
Identify the correct pair of contraceptive dosages:

 

  1. Ulipristal for emergency contraception-30mg single dose
  2. LNG for emergency contraception 1.5mg two tablets repeated after 12hrs
  3. DMPA 150mg im 3 monthly
  4. Mirena 52mg LNG with 20ug/d release
A patient has a visual acuity of less than 3/60 in the right eye and the perception of light in the left eye. In terms of visual impairment categories, to which category does this individual belong?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Social Blindness

questions.text: Match the following Mapleson circuits with the features described:

choices.text: Repeat sputum smears
Ask for CBNAAT
Ask for line probe assay
Wait until TB culture results to start ATT

questions.text: A 35-year-old homeless man presented with a 1-month history of fever, cough, and weight loss. Both sputum smears turned out to be negative, but the chest x-ray ordered was suggestive of tuberculosis. Which is the next best line of management?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Ask for CBNAAT

choices.text: Increase in sample size
Decrease in sample size
Increase in variability
Increase in confidence level

questions.text: All the following cause widening of confidence interval except?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Increase in sample size

questions.text: A person wants to study about the relationship between smoking and lung cancer, so he collects data about people diseased with lung cancer from government hospitals and the number of cigarette packets sold at the same time period. Which type of study is this?
Which of the following is not weaning mode of ventilation:
A 22-year-old female comes to the STI clinic with minimal vaginal discharge. On speculum examination, erosions are seen on the cervix. Which of the following kit should be given to this patient?

You are the team leader during a cardiac arrest resuscitation scenario in a hospital setting. A 65-year-old patient has suddenly collapsed and is unresponsive. The monitor displays a rhythm as shown in the image. What is the next immediate step?

Identify the correct statements about lower extent of the following structures:

 

  1. Subarachnoid space-Lower border of S2
  2. Filum terminale-Coccyx
  3. Spinal cords in infants-Upper border of L3
  4. Adult spinal cord-Lower border of L1

An 18-month-old girl is brought to the OPD by her parents due to a rash and blisters throughout the body that started this morning. Yesterday, the child had a fever that responded well to ibuprofen. This morning, the parents noted erythema and peeling skin around her mouth, axillae, and inguinal areas. Slight focal pressure to the back results in sloughing of the top layer of skin with underlying erythema. The face appears edematous, with perioral crusting. No mucosal lesions are seen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Staphylococcal scalded skin syndrome

choices.text: Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence
There will be a higher probability of a type I error
There will be a higher probability of finding statistically significant results
The study will have more statistical power

questions.text: A research group conducted a placebo-controlled clinical trial to assess whether a new drug to treat acute migraine with or without aura in adults is more effective than standard therapy. During the data analysis phase, the researchers decide to set alpha at 0.01 rather than 0.05. Which of the following is the most likely result of this change?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Any significant findings will be reported with greater confidence

choices.text: Human tetanus immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.text: A young male came to the hospital with a clean-cut wound without any bleeding. The patient received a full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management for this patient?
20 accidental pregnancies happen after 100 women used a new contraceptive device for 2yrs. What is the pearl index?

choices.text: Caters to a population of 2.5 lakh
Referral centre for 4-5 U-primary health centers
Other hospitals may be present in the area
Should have a 50-bed facility in metro cities

questions.text: All of the following are true about starting an urban community health center except?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Should have a 50-bed facility in metro cities

questions.text:
Identify the correct pair:

 

  1. Benefit measured in terms of natural units-Cost benefit analysis
  2. Method based on behavioral sciences-MBO
  3. PERT-Network Analysis
  4. Benefit measured in terms of QALY-Cost effective analysis

choices.text: 51%

questions.text: Identify the correct oxygen delivery devices with the maximum O2 saturation delivered:
Which of the following is the sensitive indicator to assess the availability, utilization, and effectiveness of healthcare in a community?

All of the following are true except:

 

  1. TBA, ANM, AWW are grassroot, village level workers.
  2. JE SA-14-14-2 is a live attenuated vaccine injected subcutaneously at a dose of 0.5ml in the left upper arm
  3. MMR is contraindicated in a child with SCID
  4. STEPS approach for WHO includes Behavioural, physical and psychological measurements

A 54-year-old man with hypertension and hyperlipidemia who came to the emergency department with chest pain wants to know if he is having a heart attack. Test A is newly available for diagnosing myocardial infarction (MI). In a recent study, the results of test A (compared to a gold standard diagnosis of MI) were as follows. The patient has a positive result on test A. Assuming his pre-test probability is equivalent to the prevalence of MI in the study, what is the probability that the patient has an MI?

choices.text: Tidal volume - 12 ml/kg of actual BW

questions.text: A patient of blunt chest trauma has been intubated and started on mechanical ventilation. Which of the following is not correct about the initial setting?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Tidal volume – 12 ml/kg of actual BW

questions.text:
Identify the correct statements:

 

  1. Most common cause for hospital admission after day care surgery is post-operative pain
  2. Commonly used frequency of tetanic stimulation in neuromuscular monitoring is 2Hz.
  3. Add 0.5 ml Heparin to the syringe before taking blood for ABG
  4. Dobutamine stress echocardiography is the most accurate non-invasive investigation to predict risks of perioperative cardiac complications
Which of the following agency provides integrated nutrition and health in the agr group of 6-11 years?

choices.text: CRP has no association with risk of Mi/stroke
Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/stroke
Increase in CRP decreases the risk of Ml/stroke
In quintile 1, there is no risk of MI/stroke

questions.text:
A researcher wants to know whether there is an association of CRP values with the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke. The study group was divided into quintiles and the following table is formed based on the study results. Which of the following statements is true regarding the relationship between CRP and the risk of myocardial infarction/stroke?

 

 

CRP - C-reactive protein
questions.solution: Ans. B) Increase in CRP leads to increased risk of MI/Stroke

questions.text: What is the probable diagnosis for a 38-year-old female who is experiencing substantial hair loss for 4 months and has a history of COVID-19 infection 8 months ago?

choices.text: Cardbord box with blue marking

questions.text: How is a broken vaccine vial disposed, according to biomedical waste management?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Cardbord box with blue marking

choices.text: Codex Alimentarius is the principal organ of the FAO/WHO food standards program
Vanaspati is fortified with 2500 IU of vitamin A and 175 IU of vitamin D
Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation
Sudden onset of hypersecretory glaucoma, diarrhea, and cardiac failure is seen due to sanguinarine toxicity

questions.text: All of the following are true except:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Methylene blue reduction test is the best test for efficacy of pasteurisation

questions.text:
Identify the true statements:

 

  1. The HIV sentinel surveillance includes single male migrants, truck drivers, CSW, transgenders and antenatal women
  2. Gaussion distribution is the probability distribution that describes the chances of an event in a particular time frame.
  3. Congenital glaucoma is not covered under RBSK screening
  4. According to SDG target 3.1, MMR should be <80/1 lakh live births

choices.text: Oral amoxicillin for five days
Urgent referral to the tertiary care centre immediately
Administer IV antibiotics and ask the patient to be brought after 24 hours

questions.text: A 24-month-old child weighing 11 kg was brought to the pediatric OPD. He had a respiratory rate of 38/min. On examination, chest indrawing was observed. What is the next step of management?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Oral amoxicillin for five days

choices.text: 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by same dose after 24 hours
1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 1 week
1,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose after 24 hours and after a week
2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.text: What is the dosage of vitamin A given for a 2-year-old baby with keratomalacia?
questions.solution: Ans. D) 2,00,000 IU immediately, followed by the same dose 24 hours later and after 2 weeks

questions.text:
All of the following are true about paediatric airway except:

 

  1. High position of larynx opposite C3-C4 allows simultaneous breathing while feeding
  2.  Thyroid cartilage is angulated
  3. Larynx is softer and more collapsible
  4. Shape of the laryngeal inlet is cylindrical
In a 10-year-old school child, which of the following vaccines is given as a part of the immunization programme?
Identify the type of study described in the scenario:

choices.text: CV of DBP is more than Vitamin D
CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP
Both DBP and Vitamin D have equal variability
It cannot be ascertained from information provided

questions.text: A study was conducted on two different samples for comparing variation between DBP and Vitamin D. The mean diastolic blood pressure is 110 with standard deviation 11 and the mean vitamin D level is 18 with standard deviation 3. Which of the following statement is true regarding the coefficient of variation (CV)?
questions.solution: Ans. B) CV of Vitamin D is more than DBP
